Private messenger for pseudonymous and anonymous communications
is a program which allows communicating via the cryptocurrency Hush. You can send messages to around 50 people simultaneously, allowing for encrypted mailing-list style messaging.

Using the zCash protocol, it allows transactions involving shielded addresses in addition to normal transparent Bitcoin addresses. This allows transactions without disclosing sender, receiver, message (or even that a message existed), or financial transaction amount.
is an open source project to its strength, and is motivated solely by the interests and activities of the community at large. It is one of the first coins to be traded on

, which supports HUSH and many other currencies. It allows you to exchange one cryptocurrency for another, just as you would exchange paper money in a currency exchange in an airport. It does this using a technology called Atomic Swaps. Atomic Swaps allow buyers and sellers to perform exchanges peer to peer (P2P) rather than through a centralized exchange. In the most simple terms, it acts as a sort of escrow.

Duke has commit bits to dozens of free and open source projects and has been involved in the Free+Open Source community for 20+ years. You will see his name in Firefox about:credits for helping their Javascript engine use less memory as well as on the "Nature" publication for the Tomato Genome, as part of his work with BioPerl. He also helped design the backend of OpenTreeOfLife, where scientists around the world can study how all living things are related in an open and accessible way. Duke writes code that improves the world and optimizes for increasing Freedom for average folks.

Larry is an infrastructure architect with 20+ years Linux and open source experience. He first became involved in cryptocurrency in 2011 while working at University of Michigan. There he was a participant in a study on the benefits of blockchain and bitcoin.

Matthew is a full-stack developer and cryptocurrency enthusiast from Illinois. His passions are security and authentication, and gaming. By day he is a Cyber Threat Analyst. Mathew is the author of Authparty.io, a blockchain authentication system.

Luge B is a designer and font end developer. He is a privacy advocate, and has worked on multiple blockchain projects over the past 2 years. Luge works between the US and Asia and studied at the Rhode Island School of Design.

Tamsin's most recent professional focus has been on enterprise-level computer networking as a former Network Engineer at F5 Networks. Her work troubleshooting encryption issues as well as exposure to cutting-edge networking technology dovetails naturally into an intrigue with cryptocurrency, and her experience translating dev jargon to management-speak has honed her ability to explain very technical content to non-technical audiences.

Originally a particle physicist from Czech Republic, TheTrunk has years of experience creating successful web applications and is a member of The Corporation. His focus is on Hush services and community engagement.

Software engineer at Fusion Marketing by day, cryptoasset trader, marketer, and developer by night. the8thbit is currently doing work for the up-and-coming Beaxy exchange, and manages marketing here at HUSH
is a community project. Everyone is welcomed with open arms!
